@graph.name: Baked Buffalo Wings - ULTRA CRISPY!! | RecipeTin Eats
@graph.description: No false promises here! These Baked Buffalo Wings cooked in the oven are SERIOUSLY crispy chicken wings. Tossed in Buffalo Sauce, dunk in Blue Cheese Dip!

@graph.name: Nagi
@graph.description: I believe you can make great food with everyday ingredients even if you’re short on time and cost conscious. You just need to cook clever and get creative!

@graph.name: Truly Crispy Oven Baked Buffalo Wings
@graph.description: Recipe video above. This recipe uses a genius technique discovered by Cook's Illustrated to make chicken wings in the oven that come out so crispy that it's hard to believe they aren't deep fried. Tossed in a classic Buffalo sauce and served with a side of blue cheese dip and celery sticks and you have one of the most genius food combinations this world has ever seen! Comprehensive FAQ is available in the original Crispy Baked Wings (scroll below recipe).
recipeIngredient: 5 teaspoons baking powder ((NOT baking soda / bi-carb soda) (Note 2))
1/2 cup Frank’s Original Red Hot Sauce ((Note 3))
1/2 cup crumbled blue cheese, softened ((I use gorgonzola))

itemListElement.text: If you plan ahead, lay the wings on a rack on a rimmed baking tray and let them dry uncovered in the fridge overnight. Alternatively, pat them dry with paper towels.
itemListElement.name: If you plan ahead, lay the wings on a rack on a rimmed baking tray and let them dry uncovered in the fridge overnight. Alternatively, pat them dry with paper towels.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 250°F/120°C (all oven types). Put one oven shelf in the lower quarter of the oven and one in the top quarter.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 250°F/120°C (all oven types). Put one oven shelf in the lower quarter of the oven and one in the top quarter.

itemListElement.text: Line the tray with foil. Spray the rack on the baking tray with oil.
itemListElement.name: Line the tray with foil. Spray the rack on the baking tray with oil.

itemListElement.text: Place the wings in a large bowl. Sprinkle over baking powder and salt. Use hands to toss well (or shake in ziplock bag) to coat wings evenly.
itemListElement.name: Place the wings in a large bowl. Sprinkle over baking powder and salt. Use hands to toss well (or shake in ziplock bag) to coat wings evenly.

itemListElement.text: Place the wings skin side up on the rack (ok if snug, they shrink). Bake on the lower shelf in the oven for 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Place the wings skin side up on the rack (ok if snug, they shrink). Bake on the lower shelf in the oven for 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Then move the tray up to the higher shelf and turn the oven up to 425°F / 220°C. Bake for a further 40 to 50 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through. The wings do not need to be turned over.
itemListElement.name: Then move the tray up to the higher shelf and turn the oven up to 425°F / 220°C. Bake for a further 40 to 50 minutes, rotating the tray halfway through. The wings do not need to be turned over.

itemListElement.text: The wings are ready when they are dark golden brown and the skin is very crispy.
itemListElement.name: The wings are ready when they are dark golden brown and the skin is very crispy.

itemListElement.text: Toss with Hot Sauce and serve immediately with Blue Cheese Dip and celery sticks. They can be served plain, with a dipping sauce or tossed in sauce. Wings also reheat crispy!
itemListElement.name: Toss with Hot Sauce and serve immediately with Blue Cheese Dip and celery sticks. They can be served plain, with a dipping sauce or tossed in sauce. Wings also reheat crispy!

itemListElement.text: Whisk together the Sauce ingredients. Keep warm or reheat just prior to using.
itemListElement.name: Whisk together the Sauce ingredients. Keep warm or reheat just prior to using.

itemListElement.text: Mash the blue cheese with sour cream until smooth (or to your taste).
itemListElement.name: Mash the blue cheese with sour cream until smooth (or to your taste).

itemListElement.text: Add remaining ingredients and mix well until combined, using milk to get it to the consistency you want.
itemListElement.name: Add remaining ingredients and mix well until combined, using milk to get it to the consistency you want.

itemListElement.text: Store in the fridge until required. Remove from the fridge 15 minutes before serving.
itemListElement.name: Store in the fridge until required. Remove from the fridge 15 minutes before serving.
